title: What is Enterprise Asset Management? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi There! Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) is the process of management of the assets of an enterprise across departments, facilities, business units and geographical locations. EAM integrates techniques for holistic control and optimization throughout asset life cycles, including design, commissioning, operations and replacement. EAM is categorized as follows: Physical asset and infrastructure managementIT service managementDigital asset (electronic media and content) managementFixed asset management and accountingEmerging asset managementThe EAM framework optimizes and extends asset life cycles and reduces Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) while maximizing Overall Asset Productivity (OAP) and Return on Assets (ROA), which is key for manufacturing and similar industries with high-value equipment. An Enterprise Asset Management system or often as EAM software, organizes and keep track of organizational physical assets. EAM system is a digital approach to the planning and control of all of the activities required to maintain business assets throughout each individual asset’s lifecycle using an mobile application like EAM360. These activities include, but are not limited to, the scheduling of planned maintenance, optimization of asset productivity, documentation of information in relation to breakdown and malfunctions, stock control, inventory, purchasing information and many more features. Many physical assets can be managed by an EAM. The assets may be fixed assets like buildings, plants, machinery or moving assets like vehicles, ships, forklifts, containers, ships and other moving equipment. The lifecycle management of high-value physical assets needs careful planning and execution of work. Hope that answers your question.

Hi,  Enterprise Asset Management is about managing assets that are critical to run your enterprise/business. Quite often the term is related with asset intensive industries like manufacturing, chemicals, industrial plants etc.  Maintenance Management or CMMS (Computerised Maintenace Management Systems) and Asset Management are the two other terms that are closely linked/used with Enterprise Asset Management.  In most cases Enterprise Asset Management does not include managing people as assets.  So, if you have a manufacturing plant - the element of managing your machinery, equipments, raw materials, supply chain etc is Enterprise Asset Management or EAM.   Most businesses use EAM (Enterprise Asset Management) Software to control and govern their Enterprise Assets. You can shortlist and compare EAM (Enterprise Asset Management) Options with this tool.
